HRM module¶

class HRM.DetectHeartBeat(corr_values_class)¶
find_peak_index()¶

Function that takes relative max correlation values and finds indicies (heart beats)

Parameters:
  • self.beats – array of correlation values at heart beat event
  • self.pos_corr_values – array of correlation values
Returns self.index_int:
 

index of maximum correlation values (index of heart beat)
find_peaks()¶

Function finds relative max of correlations then filters out values that do not pass threshold.

Parameters:self.pos_corr_values – array of positive correlation values
Returns self.beats:
 array of correlation values at specific heart beat events
get_rid_of_neg()¶

Function removes negative correlation values to help detect positive correlation values

Parameters:self.corr_values – instance of correlation values
Returns self.pos_corr_values:
 only positive correlation values
make_object_time()¶

Function that makes heart beat time instance

Parameters:self.index_int – index of maximum correlation values (indicies of heart beats)
Returns self.index_time:
 object containing indicies of heart beats
class HRM.HeartRateData(data, index_time=None)¶
find_avg_hr(data, index_int, interval)¶

Function finds average hr over user specified time interval

Parameters:
  • data – array that contains time and voltages
  • index_int – array containing indicies of heart beat events
  • interval – user defined value in minutes
Returns self.bpm:
 

list of average heart beat per minute
find_beat_times(data, index_time)¶

Function takes index of heart beat events and returns the corresponding time values

Parameters:
  • data – unfiltered time and voltage array
  • index_time – an instance index of heart beat events
Returns self.beat_times:
 

array of times corresponding to heart beat events
find_duration()¶

Function returns last value of time array– Duration of the ECG

Parameters:self.data – unfiltered time and voltage array
Return self.time_duration:
 last value of time array
find_number_beats()¶

Function returns number of heart beat events

Parameters:self.beat_times – array of beat times
Returns self.num_beats:
 number of total beats
find_voltage_extremes()¶

Function takes array of voltage and finds maximum and minimum

Parameters:self.data – unfiltered time and voltage array
Returns min_max:
 tuple of min and max
max_find_correlation()¶

Function finds correlation values by correlating subset (max QRS wave) to rest of signal

Parameters:self.smooth_voltage – filtered voltage array
Returns self.corr_values_class:
 an instance of correlation values based on when heart beat occured
return_attributes(duration, min_max)¶

Function takes final attributes and exports a list to be used for data exportation

Parameters:
  • duration – length of ECG array
  • min_max – voltage extremes of ECG array
Returns attributes:
 

list of final attributes
signal_process()¶

Function removes noise with savgol filter and normalized

Parameters:self.data – data instance of time and voltage
Returns smooth_voltage:
 single array of voltage
class HRM.ReadWriteData(filename=None)¶
export_data(filename, attributes)¶

Function takes list of final attributes and exports json file

Parameters:
  • filename – csv filename
  • attributes – avg hr, Volt extremes, time duration, num of beats and beat time array
Returns json_name:
 

file name of json file
make_time_voltage_object()¶

Function turns numpy array into object to be manipulated later

Parameters:self.file_datay – numpy array
Returns self.data:
 instance of data containing times and voltages
read_in_data()¶

Function takes in a csv file name and returns a numpy array

Parameters:

self.filename – csv filename
Returns self.file_data:
 

a 2d numpy array with time and voltage
Raises:
  • IOError – makes sure import file is a .csv file
  • TypeError – make sure values inside ECG trace are floats
HRM.interval_check(interval)¶

Function checks to make sure interval is greater than zero

Parameters:interval – user input time interval
Raises:ValueError – value error raised if interval is 0 or negative
